channel.title: Comments on: The least sexy and most important paper I have written so far

item.description: […] a 3-4 year long single project that you can, and should, dedicate yourself too. Now that I’m nearing the end of my own challenge, I wanted to share some simple things with you all that might help in some […]

item.title: By: rbb27

item.description: Sorry. I don't use this site very much so I accidentally posted twice. Feel free to delete the first one. I don't think I'm able to.
item.content:encoded: Sorry. I don’t use this site very much so I accidentally posted twice. Feel free to delete the first one. I don’t think I’m able to.

item.title: By: rbb27
item.dc:creator: rbb27
item.description: Apparently, most of the statistical results cited in support of the conclusions of this paper (citing AIC-weights) are actually non-significant according to p-values. Therefore, the hypothesis that sea level correlate to the observed diversity changes cannot be distinguished from the absence of a relationship. AIC-weights determine the best model out of those that you tested. They do not tell you whether that best model is any good or not. On their own, they cannot be used as evidence of a relationship between diversity patterns and sea level changes. From my perspective, this fundamentally undermines the conclusions of the work. Jon, I'd welcome any information that contradicts my reading of the results tables. At present, however, I think that this is a fairly serious misinterpretation of the results of a statisical hypothesis test.
item.content:encoded:
Apparently, most of the statistical results cited in support of the conclusions of this paper (citing AIC-weights) are actually non-significant according to p-values. Therefore, the hypothesis that sea level correlate to the observed diversity changes cannot be distinguished from the absence of a relationship.
AIC-weights determine the best model out of those that you tested. They do not tell you whether that best model is any good or not. On their own, they cannot be used as evidence of a relationship between diversity patterns and sea level changes.
From my perspective, this fundamentally undermines the conclusions of the work. Jon, I’d welcome any information that contradicts my reading of the results tables. At present, however, I think that this is a fairly serious misinterpretation of the results of a statisical hypothesis test.

Therefore, the hypothesis that sea level correlate to the observed diversity changes cannot be distinguished from the absence of a relationship. AIC-weights determine the best model out of those that you tested. They do not tell you whether that best model is any good or not. From my perspective, this fundamentally undermines the conclusions of the work. Jon, I'd welcome any information that contradicts my reading of the results you present.
item.content:encoded:
Most of the statistical results cited in support of the conclusions of this paper (citing AIC-weights) are actually non-significant according to p-values. Therefore, the hypothesis that sea level correlate to the observed diversity changes cannot be distinguished from the absence of a relationship.
AIC-weights determine the best model out of those that you tested. They do not tell you whether that best model is any good or not.
From my perspective, this fundamentally undermines the conclusions of the work. Jon, I’d welcome any information that contradicts my reading of the results you present.
